taxonomicnotes: It was described from Java, Indonesia (type locality). What is currently recognised as Monopterus albus is almost certainly a species complex, and the taxonomic identity of the eastern Himalaya population needs to be validated.
rationale: Monopterus albus as currently grouped is widespread with no major threats and is assessed as Least Concern. However it is considered a species complex and requires taxonomic revision (R. Britz pers. comm. 2010), and requires taxonomic review and should be re-assessed when this has been completed.
evaluator: Britz, R., Datta, N.C., Dey, S.C., Jha, B.R. & Allen, D.J.
